metalign.joint

Class JointModelState

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.generic.MidiModelState
      • metalign.joint.JointModelState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MidiModelState>

    public class JointModelState
extends MidiModelState
    A JointModelState is the state used to model and infer one of each type of model simultaneously as a set, one step at a time.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 8 Sept, 2015

      • JointModelState

        private JointModelState(HierarchyModelState h)
        Create a new ModelState on the given HierarchyModelState. The voiceState and the beatState will be loaded from the given HierarchyModelState.
        Parameters:
        h - hierarchyState

    • Method Detail

      • getScore

        public double getScore()
        Description copied from class: MidiModelState
        Get the score of this MidiModelState. In general, a higher score reflects that a State is more likely given our prior knowledge. The natural ordering of MidiModelStates is based on this score value.
        Specified by:
        getScore in class MidiModelState
        Returns:
        The score of this MidiModelState.

      • handleIncoming

        public java.util.TreeSet<JointModelState> handleIncoming(java.util.List<MidiNote> notes)
        Description copied from class: MidiModelState
        Return a TreeSet of all of the possible MidiModelStates which we could tansition into given the List of MidiNotes.
        Specified by:
        handleIncoming in class MidiModelState
        Parameters:
        notes - A List of the MidiNotes on which we need to transition.
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of MidiModelStates which we've transitioned into.

      • close

        public java.util.TreeSet<JointModelState> close()
        Description copied from class: MidiModelState
        Return a TreeSet of all of the possible MidiModelStates which we could tansition into when the input closes.
        Specified by:
        close in class MidiModelState
        Returns:
        A TreeSet of the MidiModelStates we've transitioned into.

        private boolean isDuplicateOf(JointModelState state)
        Decide whether the given state is a duplicate of this one.

        Returns:

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Return if this state is started yet. That is, if it has completed enough to be removed.
        Returns:
        True if it has started, false otherwise.
